meanings.definition: superlative form of frouzy, meaning unkempt or musty
meanings.sent1: The old abandoned house on the corner looked the frouziest of all.
meanings.sent2: She always wore the frouziest clothes to school, never caring about her appearance.
meanings.sent3: The frouziest room in the house was the attic, filled with forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent4: The frouziest smell of damp earth and old books lingered in the library.
meanings.sent5: The frouziest cat in the neighborhood had patches of fur sticking out in all directions.

meanings.definition: in a manner that is unkempt or musty
meanings.sent1: She walked frouziest into the room, her hair tangled and clothes wrinkled.
meanings.sent2: The old books in the library smelled frouziest, hinting at years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: He danced frouziest at the party, not caring about his appearance or steps.
meanings.sent4: The attic was filled with old trinkets, each one smelling frouziest of dust and time.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood frouziest on the street, a shadow of its former self.

meanings.definition: the state of being unkempt or musty
meanings.sent1: The frouziest of the room was evident in the cobwebs hanging from the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the frouziest of the old clothes in the thrift store.
meanings.sent3: The frouziest of the basement made it the perfect hiding spot for the kids' game.
meanings.sent4: The frouziest of the garden came from the overgrown bushes and neglected flowers.
meanings.sent5: The frouziest of the library was a haven for bookworms, despite its musty smell.
